questions.question: sore throat
questions.answer:
A saltwater gargle of 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon of table salt to 4-8 oz. of warm water can help soothe a sore throat.

Or drink honey mixed with warm water. Honey has antimicrobial properties that can help soothe a sore throat.

questions.question: headache
questions.answer:
To relieve a headache naturally, you can use peppermint oil. Applying diluted peppermint oil to your temples can provide relief from headaches.

Or you can apply crushed lagundi leaves on forehead.

questions.question: head ache
questions.answer:
To relieve a headache naturally, you can use peppermint oil. Applying diluted peppermint oil to your temples can provide relief from headaches.

Or you can apply crushed lagundi leaves on forehead.

questions.question: indigestion
questions.answer: Ginger tea is a natural remedy for indigestion. Ginger helps stimulate digestion and can reduce nausea and bloating.

questions.question: improve sleep
questions.answer: Drinking chamomile tea before bed can help improve sleep. Chamomile has calming effects that can promote better sleep.

questions.question: boost immune system
questions.answer: Consuming garlic regularly can help boost the immune system. Garlic has antibacterial and antiviral properties that support immune health.

questions.question: stress
questions.answer: Practicing deep breathing exercises can help reduce stress naturally. Deep breathing can calm the nervous system and reduce stress levels.

questions.question: acne
questions.answer:
For acne, squeeze a lemon in a bowl and few drops of rose water into it. Apply this mixture with cotton ball on affected areas such as neck or face.

Or cut an aloe vera shoot in half, scrape the gel out with a spoon and apply it to the affected area.

questions.question: pimples
questions.answer:
For pimples, squeeze a lemon in a bowl and few drops of rose water into it. Apply this mixture with cotton ball on affected areas such as neck or face.

Or cut an aloe vera shoot in half, scrape the gel out with a spoon and apply it to the affected area.

questions.question: improve digestion
questions.answer:
Consuming probiotics such as yogurt or kefir can help improve digestion. Probiotics support a healthy gut flora and aid in digestion.

Or drink plenty of fuilds.

questions.question: diarrhea
questions.answer: For diarrhea, boil chopped leaves of tsaang gubat or guava in two glasses of water for 15 minutes or until amount of water goes down 1 glass, then cool and strain and drink.

questions.question: stomachache
questions.answer: For a stomachache, boil chopped leaves of tsaang gubat in one glasses of water for 15 minutes, then cool and strain and drink.

questions.question: stomach ache
questions.answer: For a stomachache, boil chopped leaves of tsaang gubat in one glasses of water for 15 minutes, then cool and strain and drink.

questions.question: edema
questions.answer: For edema, boil chopped leaves of sambong in water for 15 minutes until 1 glassful remains then cool and strain. Divide mixture into three parts, drink one part three times a day.

questions.question: urinary stone
questions.answer: For urinary stone, boil chopped leaves of sambong in water for 15 minutes until 1 glassful remains then cool and strain. Divide mixture into three parts, drink one part three times a day.

questions.question: ring worm
questions.answer: For ring worm, apply as a soap to the affected area a pounded fresh but matured leaves of Acapulco 1 to 2 times a day.

questions.question: athleteâ€™s foot
questions.answer: For athelete's foot, apply as a soap to the affected area a pounded fresh but matured leaves of Acapulco 1 to 2 times a day.

questions.question: scabies
questions.answer:
For scabies, apply as a soap to the affected area a pounded fresh but matured leaves of Acapulco 1 to 2 times a day.

Or you can prepare a decoction of lagundi leaves, use it to wash and clean the affected area.

questions.question: worm infection
questions.answer: For worm infection, eat raw seeds of niyug-niyogan 2 hours before your last meal of the day. Adults may take 10 seeds, children 4-7 years of age may eat up to 4 seeds only, children 8-9 years old may take 6 seeds, and children 10-12 years old may eat 7 seeds. These seeds may not be given to the children below 4 years old.

questions.question: diabetes
questions.answer: For diabetes, chopped ampalaya leaves and boil 6 tablespoons in 2 glassfuls of water for 15 minutes under low fire, do not cover the pot. Cool and strain then take 1/3 cup 3 times a day after meal.

questions.question: asthma
questions.answer: For asthma, boil chopped raw fruits or leaves of lagundi in 2 glasses of water, left for 15 minutes until the water left with only 1 glass, then strain and drink.

questions.question: cough
questions.answer:
For cough, boil chopped raw fruits or leaves of lagundi in 2 glasses of water, left for 15 minutes until the water left with only 1 glass, then strain and drink.

Or you can get 10 fresh leaves of yerba buena and soak in a glass of hot water. Drink as tea. This acts as expectorant.

questions.question: fever
questions.answer: For fever, boil chopped raw fruits or leaves of lagundi in 2 glasses of water, left for 15 minutes until the water left with only 1 glass, then strain and drink.

questions.question: dysentery
questions.answer: For dysentery, boil a handful of lagundi leaves and flowers in a water to produce a glassful of decoction 3 times a day.

questions.question: cold
questions.answer:
For a cold, boil a handful of lagundi leaves and flowers in a water to produce a glassful of decoction 3 times a day.

Or you can get 10 fresh leaves of yerba buena and soak in a glass of hot water. Drink as tea. This acts as expectorant.

questions.question: gas pain
questions.answer:
For gas pain, boil a handful of lagundi leaves and flowers in 2 glasses of water to produce a glassful of decoction and drink 3 times a day.

Or you may use yerba buena leaves.

questions.question: menstrual pain
questions.answer:
For menstrual pain, boil a handful of lagundi leaves and flowers in 2 glasses of water to produce a glassful of decoction and drink 3 times a day.

Or you may use yerba buena leaves.

questions.question: dermatitis
questions.answer: For dermatitis, prepare a decoction of lagundi leaves, use it to wash and clean the affected area.

questions.question: eczema
questions.answer: For eczema, prepare a decoction of lagundi leaves, use it to wash and clean the affected area.

questions.question: wound
questions.answer: For a wound, prepare a decoction of lagundi or guava leaves, use it to wash and clean the affected area.

questions.question: rheumatism
questions.answer:
For rheumatism, wash 1 and 1/2 cup of ulasimang bato or pansit-pansitan leaves well, and boil in 2 glassfuls of water over low fire. Do not cover the pot. Cool and strain. Divide into 3 parts and drink each part 3 times a day. You may also eat as salad.

Or apply pounded lagundi leaves on affected area.

questions.question: sprain
questions.answer: For a sprain, apply pounded lagundi leaves on affected area.

questions.question: contusion
questions.answer: For a contusion, apply pounded lagundi leaves on affected area.

questions.question: insect bite
questions.answer:
For an insect bite, apply pounded lagundi leaves on affected area.

Or crush yerba buena leaves and apply juice to affected part or pound the leaves until paste like and rub on the affected area.

questions.question: gout
questions.answer: For gout, wash 1 and 1/2 cup of ulasimang bato or pansit-pansitan leaves well, and boil in 2 glassfuls of water over low fire. Do not cover the pot. Cool and strain. Divide into 3 parts and drink each part 3 times a day. You may also eat as salad.

questions.question: hypertension
questions.answer: For hypertension, garlic may be fried, roasted, soaked in vinegar for 30 minutes, or balanced in boiled water for 5 minutes. Then take 2 pieces 3 times a day after meals.

questions.question: toothache
questions.answer:
For toothache, pound garlic or guava leaves into small pieces and apply to the affected tooth.

Or cut plant and squeeze sap of yerba buena, then soak a piece of cotton in the sap and insert in aching tooth cavity. However, before inserting the cotton, mouth must be rinsed by gargling salt solution.

questions.question: tooth ache
questions.answer:
For toothache, pound garlic or guava leaves into small pieces and apply to the affected tooth.

Or cut plant and squeeze sap of yerba buena, then soak a piece of cotton in the sap and insert in aching tooth cavity. However, before inserting the cotton, mouth must be rinsed by gargling salt solution.

questions.question: nausea
questions.answer: For nausea, crush leaves of yerba buena and apply at nostrils.

questions.question: fainting
questions.answer: For fainting, crush leaves of yerba buena and apply at nostrils.

questions.question: dizziness
questions.answer: For dizziness, you should lie down until it passes and get up slowly, move carefully and slowly, then drink plenty of fluids specially water.

questions.answer: Hello! How can I help you today.

questions.question: goodbye
questions.answer: Goodbye! Always take care of yourself.

questions.question: bye
questions.answer: Goodbye! Always take care of yourself.

questions.question: not feeling well
questions.answer: I'm sorry to hear that, can you please specify what exactly you are feeling?

questions.question: help
questions.answer: Yes? How can I assist you today?

questions.question: thank you
questions.answer: Your welcome! Always happy to help.
